fig.label: Figure 1
fig.sd-panel: A Schematic representation of the integrated mini virus (A1 J-Lat Tat-GFP) utilized in the primary screen of small molecules. Expression of the GFP reporter is under control of the HIV-1 LTR promoter in this cell line.
B Arrayscanimages of untreated cells (left panel), or cells treated with PMA for 24 hours (right panel: Green-GFP; Blue-Hoechst; Red-PI).

C Distribution of GFP expression produced by treatment with compounds from the CCBN, LCGC and DIVERSet libraries (black), or untreated cells (grey). Results are presented as percent GFP expression relative to a positive control reference sample treated with PMA (green) and determined from three biological replicates (n=3).

fig.label: Figure 2
fig.sd-panel: A Schematic representation of the pTY-LAI-luciferase reporter virus used in secondary screening assays, where luciferase expression is under the control of the 5' LTR, in cloned lines derived from JurkatTAT cells bearing single copy integrants.

B-F Luciferase activity was measured from reporter cells treated for 24 hours with the indicated compound concentrations. Results are presented as percent activation relative to PMA treated controls. The EC50 for each compound is indicated. Mean and standard error (SE) for the results are determined from three biological replicates (n=3) and technical duplicates.
G Illustration of chemical structures of the PH compounds.

fig.label: Figure 3

sd-panel.p: JurkatTat cells were treated with 7 ÂµM of each compound, 50 nM PMA or left untreated (No drug control) for 24 h.
A IL-2 expression was measured in culture supernatants using an ELISA.

fig.sd-panel:
JurkatTat cells were treated with 7 ÂµM of each compound, 50 nM PMA or left untreated (No drug control) for 24 h.
B Cell surface CD69 expression was measured by flow cytometry.
Data information: For statistical analysis, mean and SE for the results are determined from three biological replicates (n=3). Statistical significance, as determined by ratio paired t test is indicated: ***, P= 0.0008; ns, no significant difference.

fig.label: Figure 4
fig.sd-panel: A-E The JurkatTat LTR-luciferase cell line was treated with the EC50/4, EC50, EC50*4 of PH01 - PH05, alone or in combination with 300 nM SAHA, 100 nM Chaetocin, 1 ÂµM Ionomycin, or 10 nM PEP005 as indicated. Luciferase activity was measured after 24 h, and the results are presented as percent activation relative to results from PMA treatment (percent activation for the EC50 of each compound are shown here).

Â
F The JurkatTatÂ LTR-luciferaseÂ cellÂ line was treated with the indicated concentrations of PEP005 alone (upper panel) and in combination with the PH compounds (EC50) (lower panel). Luciferase activity was measured after 24 h, and the results are presented as percent activation described above.Â
Data information: Mean and SE for the results are determined from three biological replicates (n=3) and technical duplicates. Statistical significance, derived from one-way ANOVA analysis is indicated as: *, P<0.05; **, P<0.005; ***, P<0.0005; ****, P<0.00005. The exact P-values are indicated in the Appendix Table S1.Â

fig.label: Figure 5
fig.sd-panel: A The effect of PH compounds was analysed using clonal lines bearing single copy integrations of the mini-dual fluorescent HIV-1 LTR reporter, md-HIV, where GFP is constitutively expressed from the EIF-1Î± internal promoter, and DsRed from the 5' LTR.

B Fluorescence-activated cell sorting (FACS) of cells bearing md-HIV provirus indicates expression of EIF-1Î±-GFP and LTR-dsRed. Stimulation of the md-HIV lines generally causes a shift of the fluorescence profile from GFP+/DsRed- toward GFP+/DsRed+.

C-D Clone 11
were treated with the indicated concentrations of PH02 (left panels) or PH02 in combination with 10 nM PEP005 (right panels) for 24 h and cells analysed by flow cytometry. Results presented as Îmean fluorescence intensity (ÎMFI) of DsRed expression and fold increase in DsRed expression for solo and combination treatments, respectively.
Data Information: Mean and SE are determined from three biological replicates (n=3) and technical duplicates. Statistical significance, as determined by one-way ANOVA is indicated: ****, P<0.00005. The exact P-values are listed in the Appendix Table S1.

sd-panel.p: clone 131 were treated with the indicated concentrations of PH02 (left panels) or PH02 in combination with 10 nM PEP005 (right panels) for 24 h and cells analysed by flow cytometry. Results presented as Îmean fluorescence intensity (ÎMFI) of DsRed expression and fold increase in DsRed expression for solo and combination treatments, respectively.

Data Information: Mean and SE are determined from three biological replicates (n=3) and technical duplicates. Statistical significance, as determined by one-way ANOVA is indicated: ****, P<0.00005. The exact P-values are listed in the Appendix Table S1.

fig.label: Figure 6
fig.sd-panel: A Chromatin immunoprecipitation assays were performed using JurkatTat LTR-DsRed, clone 11. The cells were treated for 24 h with PH02 and/ or PEP005, and ChIP was performed using antibodies against histone H3K9-me3 (left panel) and histone H3K9-ac (right panel). The results are presented relative to ChIP with anti-histone H3 antibodies.

Â
B Western blot analysis was performed using JurkatTat LTR-DsRed, clone 11, to detect the expression of SP1, NFÎºB p65, IÎºBÎ±, total H3K9-me3, and H3K9ac. The cells were treated for 24 h with PH02 and/or PEP005.Â
Data information: The results are determined from three biological replicates (n=3). Statistical significance, as determined by ratio paired t test, is indicated as follows: ***, P<0.0005; ****, P<0.00005. The exact P-values are indicated in the Appendix Table S1. Source data is available for Figure 6B.Â

fig.label: Figure 7

sd-panel.p: MTT assay was performed to assess cell viability 24 hours post treatment. Results are normalized relative to untreated controls and presented as survival rate percentage. The indicated mean and SE for the results are determined from three biological replicates (n=3) and technical duplicates.
A JurkatTat cells were treated with the indicated concentrations of the PH compounds.

fig.sd-panel: MTT assay was performed to assess cell viability 24 hours post treatment. Results are normalized relative to untreated controls and presented as survival rate percentage. The indicated mean and SE for the results are determined from three biological replicates (n=3) and technical duplicates.B PBMCs from healthy donors were treated with the indicated concentrations of the PH compounds.

MTT assay was performed to assess cell viability 24 hours post treatment. Results are normalized relative to untreated controls and presented as survival rate percentage. The indicated mean and SE for the results are determined from three biological replicates (n=3) and technical duplicates.C PBMCs from healthy donors were treated with the indicated concentrations of the PH compounds in combination with 10 nM PEP005.

fig.label: Figure 8
fig.sd-panel: Resting CD4+ T cells purified from patient samples (n= 18, Appendix Table S3) were treated with 30 ÂµM of each PH compound for 24 hours, and HIV-1Â RNA was measured in culture supernatants. Results are presented as HIV virions/mL.

sd-panel.p: Expression of CD69 on PBMCs from three healthy donors (A, B, C- n=3) was measured by flow cytometry following 24 h treatment with 3 ÂµM of PH02 alone, or in combination with the indicated concentration of PEP005. Positive control samples were treated with PMA.

Data information: Statistical significance, as determined by one-way ANOVA is indicated: *, P<0.05; **, P<0.005; ***, P<0.0005; ****, P<0.00005; ns, no significant difference. The exact P-values are indicated in the Appendix Table S1.

fig.label: Figure 10
fig.sd-panel: A Expression of intracellular HIV-1 mRNA was determined from pools of CD4+ T cells from aviremic HIV-infected patients (n= 3, Appendix Table S4) following 24 h treatment as indicated. Results have been shown as fold induction relative to untreated controls.

B Quantitative viral outgrowth assays (qVOA) were used to measure reactivation of HIV-1 provirus from latency in pools of cells from patients. Cells were treated with the indicated concentrations of PH02 and/ or PEP005 for 24 h, prior to analysis of virus production. As indicated in the Appendix Table S5, five different CD4+ T cells pools (n=5) were used for this analysis.
